0.最棒的一部！！
无论是画质、NPC还是物品交互都很完美！
这是我玩过最有代入感的FPS，没有之一！

1.弗地冈人真可爱。
   “OHH FREEMAN”，不知道外星人的喉咙是怎么发出如此标准、文采斐然的英语的（只有EP2没中文配音，只好听英语喽）。“如果一个洞弗里曼没有从里面钻出来过，那它就不能算是洞”，弗地冈人族的英语水平在20年间得到大幅提升，以至于我不知道他是认真的还是在调侃我。
   你在白森林基地里看到一位穿着制服的弗地冈先生，他醇厚的嗓音、光滑的皮肤、嘴里露出来不时蠕动的三颗牙使你充满了决心。

2.V社游戏的鼠标灵敏度一直很迷，是我的体质问题吗？即使把灵敏度拉倒最低还是快得不像话。用控制台的sensitity指令可以解决，好在流程刚开始就知道了，不然会毁掉完美的游戏体验的XD。

Half Life is one of those sacred games, beyond reproach to PC players. The series of games are sometimes brilliant and sometimes lovely looking ordinary in disguise, but they garner universal praise no matter what. How does this one stack up?

If you are reading this you know it was unintentionally the last instalment in a trilogy and it’s ok that it is, because it is terrific. It’s the best instalment since the original game. You are out in the forest and mountains so that screen of collected shades of grey that dominate HL2 and Episode 1 are gone. You play with Alyx again, but things are just a bit more varied than before. You have Vortigens on your side, you need to rescue individuals, take on walkers and reset electronics to get out of locked compounds and drive a car. Now when the car driving requirement appeared I sighed because I’ve never been a fan of HL vehicle driving. It has always seemed boring, badly executed and pretty pointless. But this car is the cats pyjamas and changes everything. This is great driving. You can control speed easily, paths are obvious and the variety of tasks works well - tracking devices, running over enemies, punching past blockades and delivering bombs against a timer. Previously, transport in Half Life was simply about pointlessly getting from one pitched battle to another, but in this episode it is much more integrated to the mission play and therefore more joyous. In fact everything about this iteration of the HL series is great, puzzles, difficulty, balance, choice of tactic. It all works well together as a whole. 

This is Half Life back to it’s best and is easily the best in the series. It is not hard to understand why people ached for a completion of the series because the only complaint about the game is that you can complete it in about nine hours and are left with the adrenaline pumping and nowhere left to go. 

It has been free to play on Steam for a while as a promotion to the upcoming release of HL: ALYX, but if you miss that then it is also part of the Orange box for a stupidly cheap price and on its own full price is still only about £5. It has a moderate 3.5% dropout rate on Howlongtobeat.com meaning that the balance of challenge and desire to continue seems about right. Across the board (Steam, Metacritics, Howlongtobeat.com) Episode 2 gets the universal HL praise we’ve become accustomed to, but it is most definitely deserved here.
Awesome, but all the stuff with the striders was very difficult. Then again, I suck at games.

Just finished all of the Half-Life games, in sequence, and I am simply blown away at how good this game is, in 2020, a week and a half away from Half-Life: Alyx. I am beyond satisfied with everything in this game, and while there are a few tiny hiccups here and there, like being caught on something that might not make the most sense, the game is a true masterpiece. I haven't been this happy with a series of games in a long time, and I remember when Half-Life 2 was released. I was only about 10, but I remember adults at the local Gamestop freaking out about it. Here I am, playing it 16 years later, getting my mind rocked. Game was an insane ride, from start to......well, not finish, but you know what I mean. CANNOT wait for Alyx. Here's to hoping it can be as memorable as these.

I'd like to take a moment to address you directly, Valve. 

Yes. I'm talking to you, the so-called "Greatest game company". I have a question for you. How could you have thrown it all away? It staggers the mind. A company of video games, with the ability to create single player masterpieces and incredible storytelling, choosing instead to embark on a path of ignorance and decay. Make no mistake, Valve. This is not a gaming revolution you have sparked...this is death and finality. 

You have plunged humanity into freefall. Even if you released Half-Life 3 now, I cannot guarantee that the gaming community would accept it. At the moment, I fear they have begun to look upon even Laidlaw with suspicion. So much for serving as the half life community's representative. 

Win back their trust, Valve. Release Half-Life 3 while you still can. Help ensure that Steam's trust in you is not misguided.
